TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IMoniker

Docs.summary: Provides the managed definition of the interface, with COM functionality from and .

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about the `IMoniker`, `IPersist`, and `IPersistStream` interfaces, see the MSDN Library.
The common language runtime throws an exception when a COM method in native code returns an HRESULT. For more information, see [How to: Map HRESULTs and Exceptions](~/docs/framework/interop/how-to-map-hresults-and-exceptions.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public void BindToObject (System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IBindCtx pbc, System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkToLeft, ref Guid riidResult, out object ppvResult);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void BindToObject(class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IBindCtx pbc, class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkToLeft, valuetype System.Guid riidResult, object ppvResult) cil managed

Docs.param: A reference to the interface on the bind context object used in this binding operation.
A reference to the moniker to the left of the current moniker, if the moniker is part of a composite moniker.
The interface identifier (IID) of the interface that the client intends to use to communicate with the object that the moniker identifies.
When this method returns, contains a reference to the interface requested by riidResult. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Uses the moniker to bind to the object that it identifies.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about `IMoniker::BindToObject`, see the MSDN Library.

MemberSignature.Value: public void BindToStorage (System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IBindCtx pbc, System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkToLeft, ref Guid riid, out object ppvObj);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void BindToStorage(class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IBindCtx pbc, class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkToLeft, valuetype System.Guid riid, object ppvObj) cil managed

Docs.param: A reference to the interface on the bind context object used during this binding operation.
A reference to the moniker to the left of the current moniker, if the moniker is part of a composite moniker.
The interface identifier (IID) of the storage interface requested.
When this method returns, contains a reference to the interface requested by riid. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Retrieves an interface pointer to the storage that contains the object identified by the moniker.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about `IMoniker::BindToStorage`, see the MSDN Library.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CommonPrefixWith (System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkOther, out System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker ppmkPrefix);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CommonPrefixWith(class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkOther, class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker ppmkPrefix) cil managed

Docs.param: A reference to the interface on another moniker to compare with the current moniker for a common prefix.
When this method returns, contains the moniker that is the common prefix of the current moniker and pmkOther. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Creates a new moniker based on the common prefix that this moniker shares with another moniker.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about `IMoniker::CommonPrefixWith`, see the MSDN Library.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ComposeWith (System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkRight, bool fOnlyIfNotGeneric, out System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker ppmkComposite);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ComposeWith(class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkRight, bool fOnlyIfNotGeneric, class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker ppmkComposite) cil managed

Docs.param: A reference to the interface on a moniker to append to the end of the current moniker.

to indicate that the caller requires a nongeneric composition. The operation proceeds only if pmkRight is a moniker class that the current moniker can combine with in some way other than forming a generic composite. to indicate that the method can create a generic composite if necessary.
When this method returns, contains a reference to the resulting composite moniker. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Combines the current moniker with another moniker, creating a new composite moniker.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about `IMoniker::ComposeWith`, see the MSDN Library.

Docs.param: to enumerate the monikers from left to right. to enumerate from right to left.
When this method returns, contains a reference to the enumerator object for the moniker. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

Docs.param: A reference to the bind context to use in this operation.
A reference to the moniker to the left of the current moniker, if the moniker is part of a composite moniker.
When this method returns, contains the display name string. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Gets the display name, which is a user-readable representation of the current moniker.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about `IMoniker::GetDisplayName`, see the MSDN Library.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GetTimeOfLastChange (System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IBindCtx pbc, System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkToLeft, out System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FILETIME pFileTime);

A reference to the moniker to the left of the current moniker, if the moniker is part of a composite moniker.

Docs.summary: Provides a number representing the time that the object identified by the current moniker was last changed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about `IMoniker::GetTimeOfLastChange`, see the MSDN Library.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Hash(int32 pdwHash) cil managed

MemberSignature.Value: public void Inverse (out System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker ppmk);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Inverse(class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker ppmk) cil managed

Docs.param: When this method returns, contains a moniker that is the inverse of the current moniker. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Provides a moniker that, when composed to the right of the current moniker or one of similar structure, composes to nothing.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about `IMoniker::Inverse`, see the MSDN Library.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 IsEqual(class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkOtherMoniker) cil managed

Docs.param: A reference to the moniker to use for comparison.
Docs.summary: Compares the current moniker with a specified moniker and indicates whether they are identical.
Docs.returns: An value if the monikers are identical; otherwise, an value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about `IMoniker::IsEqual`, see the MSDN Library.

MemberSignature.Value: public int IsRunning (System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IBindCtx pbc, System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkToLeft, System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkNewlyRunning);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 IsRunning(class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IBindCtx pbc, class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkToLeft, class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkNewlyRunning) cil managed

Docs.param: A reference to the bind context to use in this binding operation.
A reference to the moniker to the left of the current moniker if the current moniker is part of a composite.
A reference to the moniker most recently added to the Running Object Table (ROT).
Docs.summary: Determines whether the object that is identified by the current moniker is currently loaded and running.
Docs.returns: An value if the moniker is running; an value if the moniker is not running; or an value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about `IMoniker::IsRunning`, see the MSDN Library.

MemberSignature.Value: public int IsSystemMoniker (out int pdwMksys);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 IsSystemMoniker(int32 pdwMksys) cil managed

Docs.param: When this method returns, contains a pointer to an integer that is one of the values from the enumeration, and refers to one of the COM moniker classes. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether this moniker is of one of the system-supplied moniker classes.
Docs.returns: An value if the moniker is a system moniker; otherwise, an value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For details on the values of the `MKSYS` enumeration and for information about `IMoniker::IsSystemMoniker`, see the MSDN Library.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ParseDisplayName (System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IBindCtx pbc, System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkToLeft, string pszDisplayName, out int pchEaten, out System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker ppmkOut);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ParseDisplayName(class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IBindCtx pbc, class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkToLeft, string pszDisplayName, int32 pchEaten, class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker ppmkOut) cil managed

Docs.param: A reference to the bind context to use in this binding operation.
A reference to the moniker that has been built from the display name up to this point.
A reference to the string containing the remaining display name to parse.
When this method returns, contains the number of characters that were consumed in parsing pszDisplayName. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
When this method returns, contains a reference to the moniker that was built from pszDisplayName. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Reads as many characters of the specified display name as the understands and builds a moniker corresponding to the portion read.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about `IMoniker::ParseDisplayName`, see the MSDN Library.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Reduce (System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IBindCtx pbc, int dwReduceHowFar, ref System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker ppmkToLeft, out System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker ppmkReduced);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Reduce(class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IBindCtx pbc, int32 dwReduceHowFar, class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker ppmkToLeft, class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker ppmkReduced) cil managed

Docs.param: A reference to the interface on the bind context to use in this binding operation.
A value that specifies how far the current moniker should be reduced.
A reference to the moniker to the left of the current moniker.

When this method returns, contains a reference to the reduced form of the current moniker, which can be if an error occurs or if the current moniker is reduced to nothing. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Returns a reduced moniker, which is another moniker that refers to the same object as the current moniker but can be bound with equal or greater efficiency.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about `IMoniker::Reduce`, see the MSDN Library.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RelativePathTo (System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkOther, out System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker ppmkRelPath);

Docs.param: A reference to the moniker to which a relative path should be taken.
When this method returns, contains a reference to the relative moniker. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Supplies a moniker that, when appended to the current moniker (or one with a similar structure), yields the specified moniker.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about `IMoniker::RelativePath`, see the MSDN Library.
